Interface playn.core.Mouse

Changed Methods
boolean hasMouse() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns true if the underlying platform supports mouse interaction.
boolean isEnabled() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns true if mouse interaction is enabled, false if not.
boolean isLockSupported() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. True if lock has a chance of success on this platform (the user may still block it, or detection may be broken for some browsers).
boolean isLocked() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. True if the mouse is locked.
Listener listener() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns the currently configured global mouse listener, or null.
void lock() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Lock the mouse, i.e.
void setEnabled(boolean) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Allows mouse interaction to be temporarily disabled.
void setListener(Listener) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Sets the listener that will receive mouse events.
void unlock() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Unlock the mouse.
